text: Kutub al-Sittah are the main hadith collections in Sunni Islam meaning the six books. They are sometimes called the Sahih Sittah. They consist of Sahih al- Bukhari, Sahih Muslim, Sunan as-Sughra, Sunan Abu Dawood, Jami al-Tirmidhi and Sunan ibn Majah.World Religions in Practice: A Comparative Introduction, Paul Gwynne - 2011 Huraira is the most quoted person in these books. ==References== Category:Hadith Category:Hadith Books
title: Kutub al-Sittah
